articles.description: Early results from the COVID-19 antibody test conducted last week show two percent of tested MUSC employees had the antibodies.
articles.content:
CHARLESTON, S.C. (WCSC) - Early results from the COVID-19 antibody test conducted last week show two percent of tested MUSC employees had the antibodies.
Testing of MUSC staff began last Monday. These early results contain 920 tests in the first week.
Antib… [+2614 chars]

articles.title: At least 13 workers at Oregon seafood processing plant test positive for COVID-19 - KGW.com
articles.description: Bornstein Seafood’s entire workforce is being tested for the virus while its Astoria facilities are shut down.
articles.content:
ASTORIA, Ore. An Oregon seafood company has closed its facilities in Astoria after at least 13 workers tested positive for COVID-19.
Thirty-five Bornstein Seafood employees were tested for COVID-19 on Saturday after showing symptoms of the coronavirus, accor… [+1067 chars]

articles.title: Defense minister claims Israel's biological institute developed virus vaccine - The Times of Israel
articles.description: Naftali Bennett hails 'amazing achievement'; his office says shadowy defense research facility moving to patent treatment, approaching international companies to mass produce it

articles.title: Bat Woman scientist’s chilling pandemic warning a year ago amid claims China lied to world - Mirror Online
articles.description: Shi Zhengli was 'muzzled' by Chinese authorities following the discovered of Covid-19, it has been claimed, followed by allegations that China had deliberately suppressed or destroyed evidence about the coronavirus pandemic
articles.content:
Shi Zhengli is one of the world's authorities on coronavirus - and how it orginated before being passed onto humans.

articles.author: RT
articles.title: First Covid-19 case in France could have been as early as December, new evidence suggests - RT
articles.description: The first coronavirus case in France could have occurred a month earlier than official figures suggest, according to a professor from Avicenne Hospital, following the retesting of 24 patient blood samples.
articles.content: Professor Yves Cohen from the Avicenne Hospital in Bobigny said in an interview with local media that it appears that Covid-19 was already in France at the end of 2019 – rather than in January-February 2020 – as had previously been thought. A decision was mad… [+1016 chars]

articles.title: Pharma giants granted coronavirus approvals but doubts remain on manufacturing a global vaccine - CNBC
articles.description: Experts warn that vaccine timelines look ambitious and argue more thought is needed on manufacturing.
articles.content:
